trans-unit.source: Specifies how conditional expressions defined by an <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute"></xref> instance are used in verification.

When using extending a class, member or indexer with a <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute>, you may define how the conditional expression, defined by the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A> properties, is used by specifying one of the VerificationRule values.
If in the creation of the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute> no VerificationRule is specified, the default value of Required is used.

The left side of a verification rule's conditional expression is the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> and the right side is the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationConditionalOperator> specifies how the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalProperty%2A> is to be compared to the <xref:System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute.ConditionalValue%2A>.
The conditional expression specified in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute"></xref> instance must have a left hand side that is not an empty string ("").
The conditional expression specified in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute"></xref> instance is prohibited.
The conditional expression specified in an <xref href="System.Web.UI.VerificationAttribute"></xref> instance is required.
